label: Description
value: One of eleven miscellaneous cards without designation of origin. This one depicts a winter scene with a house in the background. In the foreground, a boy offers a girl a branch of mistletoe.

label: Description
value: A c-shaped garland of foliage and flowers, a hand with a red bracelts pokes out from underneath at left and a blue bird sits on a branch at right.

label: Description
value: A black and orange bird seated on a branch is depicted on the recto.

label: Description
value: An arabian man standing with a long stick in front of a diamond shaped view of the desert and pyramids
Drink McLaughlin's XXXX Coffee / Gathering Eggs in Grandpa's Barn

label: Description
value: Image of a small girl standing in front of a fence and haying holding a basket of eggs in one hand and a single egg in the other.  At the top left corner a glimpse of a hens' nest, at upper right corner a view of a farm.
Advertisement for McLaughlin's Coffee from the Children's Scenes and Life Series

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Scene of a group of children; a boy and girl seated on turned wooden stools playing checkers while two other girls watch.  Their play area is atop a green carpet with blue border.  The interior space is divided into two planes: a flat mushroom brown color for the floor and a pale mustard yellow to indicate the walls.  The children all have fair complexions and are neatly scrubbed wearing gowns and pinafores, while the boy wears yellow knee breeches, a white shirt with yellow bow, and matching boots. The girl at right carries a doll wearing a red dress.

label: Description
value: Straight beaker, rounded at bottom. On sides, tooled irregular nubs. Greenish-gold iridescence.

label: Description

label: Description
value: Fragment of woven wool with polychromy design showing a pair of facing birds, floral medallion and dark shapes. In main body of the garment, at given intervals, triple weft threads are run through.  Mounted on plain weave linen.

value: Pre-1962: Josephine Howell collection; 1962: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Garment fragments of undyed linen with stripes of supplementary red wool wefts. Wool is thicker than linen warp, causing it to skip warps at irregular intervals. Striped  pattern set off from piece by a double-sided embroidered row of split stitches in red and yellow wool.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, linen Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1962: Josephine Howell collection; 1962: acquired by the Museum.

label: Notes
value: Two children stand in a large wooden tub of water surrounded by four children who play outside the tub. At the right, a nude woman, seated on a gothic-style bench, bathes another child who is lying across her lap.

label: Description
value: Cylindrical, with cut slab handle running top to bottom on one side. Large all-over diamond-shaped motifs repeat around middle, narrow patterned bands at top and bottom. Buff clay with overglaze, painted green, blue, and terra-cotta.

value: R. Thornton Wilson; 1962: acquired by Museum

label: Description

value: Medium: cotton Technique: appliquéd plain and roller-printed fabrics, quilted

Design for a Mantel in the Chinese Taste, plate 36, in One Hundred and Fifty New Designs

label: Description
value: Design for a fireplace mantel and irons in the Chinoiserie style. Above, a putti astride a flying bird carrying lightning bolts. Directly below, a painting of a ship in a storm. Birds, tree branches and a marine caryatid below, at either side.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes Miles Carpenter

Three Designs for Wall Sconces in the Chinese Taste, Plate 48 in One Hundred and Fifty New Designs

label: Description
value: Three designs for wall sconces in the Chinoiserie style. Left: a Chinese man sits above branches and scrolls, a clock below and a candle right and left. At center:  A rocaille head, a candle, right and left center; Right: a small windmill with branches around and a mule below.

label: Physical description
value: Etching on cream laid paper, bound in book

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes Miles Carpenter
Three Designs for Torcheres in the Chinese Taste (Plate 13 of "One Hundred and Fifty New Designs")

label: Description
value: Three designs for torcheres in the Chinoiserie style. Right, scroll work, supporting two dolphins with intertwined tails. Center, heavy rocaille, with a dog where the legs intersect, and a dragon on top. Left, rocaille work, with tree branches and a flute player. Bottom, the artists' names and date.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Agnes Miles Carpenter
Plate 18 in One Hundred and Fifty New Designs

label: Description
value: Four table leg designs; upper design shows a snake wrapped around neck of a hawk; left design: putto supports table; right design: head/mask/bust; lower design: bird with vines and rinceaux.

label: Physical description
value: Etching on cream laid paper, bound in book

Catafalque of Maria-Theresa of Austria, Notre Dame, Paris

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The catafalque is shown supported by mourning figures standing on a high platform. Ermine-trimmed curtains are supported by a balduchin. A group of figures stand at the left. Below, artists' names.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in black ink on paper

label: Credit line
